this game is amazing it survived the test of time and its vary popular and continues to grow even more with new characters new changes and many more, it even has characters from other popular games like resident evil and silent hill, with more coming along the way, not only games but iconic horror franchises too, Michel Myers for example, the bad things about the game is some bugs and the community is really bad but the bugs and the community are getting better, bugs get fixed and the community is getting more friendly and helpful, of curse people are people so there will sadly still be mean people but the amount its shrinking, i think the game is worth the price

VERY fun, specially if you play with friends in Custom match. Although I'd advice to buy the DLC only in offer, since even though they play different (each killer does) they don't bring much to the table aside from personal preference, you can have fun with every type of killer and the gameplan is the same. After you do the tutorials you'll be tempted to spent all your freshly acquired bloodpoints on the bloodweb (talent trees that are individual for each character all with unique perks) but if you plan on playing with your friends alone, don't. In Custom match all is unlocked, and character levels only apply on public matches.
Great game to play with friends. Always nice to have new killers to run from.

Honestly? This game is really fun, but it has more flaws than I could ever count. The game has been buggy ever since the RE chapter update, the players are toxic as all hell, the game balance is terrible and that's just a few of my complaints. Do I love this game? Yes, I do. Is this game good? I don't think so. Especially with the matchmaking system for lower rank killers (in the EU region specifically) it just sucks, going against 4 red ranks as your first killer match ever is the worst. Those are pretty much my thoughts, I enjoy the game but I wouldn't reccomend it to anyone in this state.
Jogo Muito Bom S√≥ que ruim.

[b] Pros:

DBD has plenty of licensed characters and maps. 
It is really fun and nice to face Ghostface as Laurie Strode on Midwich Elementary School. This is basically a multiplayer game for horror fans. If you enjoy the genre as a whole, this game might just be for you, simply because of all the characters that are included. Michael Myers was the sole reason I wanted to play this game, because I already was a big fan of the Halloween franchise and his character and I believe at least one licensed character can get quite a few horror fans excited.

DBD has a unique artstyle, music and atmosphere. 
The game has a unique uncomfortable horror vibe, even if it isn't exactly 'scary'. 
The creepy, fleshy sounds the UI makes are recognizable as hell and give a nice vibe. 
The art style is unique and good. The artists working at Behavior are incredibly talented and passionate. While the game might not have the best graphics, it has a really cool artstyle which I personally enjoy. 
Thanks to this, this maps (for the most part) look very nice and atmospheric. 
The music in this game is for the most part amazing. The different chase and terror radius themes each killer has are unique, uncomfortable and/or absolute bangers. Each gives each killer a unique identity and makes them stand out. I personally wish they would add unique themes for each map to play in the background outside of chase/the killers terror radius.
The sound design is also very satisfying. The squishy splatter sound survivors make when getting hit. for example, is very exciting.

DBD has a unique gameplay concept.
A 4v1 cat and mouse type game. The thrill of hiding and running away from the killer and the thrill of hunting down survivors is great and really fun most of the times.
As killer you have to track down and kill all 4 survivors, before the survivors repair all generators and escape.
You have to play time efficient and plan ahead. You have to make lots of decisions in very short time and while it can be frustrating it is also satisfying.
As survivor you face the killer in a team of 4 and have to work together to survive. 
Survivors can either hide or loop the killer. That includes running to structures and trying to mindgame the killer to keep them busy for as long as possible. Looping a killer is almost like parkour. You have to be aware of your surroundings at all times and keep in mind that there is a killer with a unique ability chasing you down.

DBD has huge variety in maps and killers.
There are a lot of unique maps, that all play and feel differently. Not only that, but the layout is randomized each time, meaning that certain tiles, doors and windows  spawn differently each match. 
There are well over 20 killers in this game, each having a unique ability. There is a killer for pretty much everyone.





Cons:

The grind in this game is immense. 
It takes forever to entirely level up all characters with all perks. I currently have 463 hours. I have exactly 3 killers with all perks unlocked that are currently available for me, only one of which is prestiged to level 3. You probably have to sacrifice over 1000 hours to completely level up everything. But then again; the grind ensures that there is a goal to work towards. 

A lot of killers and perks are locked behind huge paywalls. 
You have to pay a huge amount of money to unlock all the characters and the perks, some of which are essential for playing on high level, so you will sort of be forced to pay more than 20 bucks to be able to compete after a certain point. I already paid way too much into this game than I'd like to admit, simply because I wanted to have certain perks a survivor or killer had.

There are plenty of balancing issues.
Example being the recent inclusion of the perk "Boon: Circle of Healing" which completely broke the meta and pretty much killed a whole playstyle for killer. 
Other than that, there are maps that are very sided towards either killers or survivors. 
On top of that, the meta is very stale. Naturally, you could apply this to any multiplayer game, but out of the hundreds and hundreds of perks you mostly see only around 6 each match in high level.

The community can be toxic. 
I personally changed my profile settings so that only my friends could comment because I have received several "-rep camper and tunneler" or "-rep bad teammate" at best and much worse insults at worst because of this game. The players in this game are very entitled. Many survivor mains expect killers to play a certain way to be nice and considerate of their fun (They usually aren't considerate in return) and blame the killer for their failure. You have to have a rather thick skin because you'll be insulted quite a bit and be able to take it. 

The devs are confusing.
I do not understand them. Sometimes they make good changes and other times they seem incompetent, almost as if they didn't know their own game. 
BHVR are one of the weirdest (and maybe worst) game developers I've come across, to the point, where I genuinely don't know what to expect from them.




Conclusion

This game is not for everyone. It is a niche type of multiplayer game that not everyone can enjoy to the same degree. It can serve as a nice party-type game with friends, but you can also sweat the hell out of it and dedicated loads of money and hours into this. There are plenty of downsides, but I think the game is still fun and can be enjoyed. Since this is a multiplayer game, where the community has an overall competitive attitude, you cannot expect each match to go great or be fun. The lows in this game can be incredibly low and the highs can be incredibly high. 
I would still recommend this game, and tell people to try it out, especially if they enjoy the horror genre.

I purchased this game after years of my friends asking me to buy it and play with them. Let me be clear...I had full dislike of this game going into it and after playing a few hours my mind hasn't been changed. I played the horrid shitfest that is Friday the 13th and loathed that game entirely. I was told that Dead by Daylight was a much better version of that game. It was nowhere near as buggy but ever so much a shitfest of a game. Super sluggish controls, terrible skill checks during an already stressful hide and seek game, and also the killer apparently has never seen a pallet or ever missed a swing before because everytime you are faced with either of those things the Killer just stands there like "my brain no understand wut just happin" and you cant move. The graphics are arent the best even on Ultra, but i can get past the visuals. The main thing that holds this back imo is the terrible controls and interactions.

Long story short, dont give in to peer pressure and if you have reservations about this or any game then follow your gut and  dont waste your time or money.

[h1] Dead By Daylight Review [/h1]

[u] Explanation [/u]

After almost one year of playing this game, I've decided to make an honest review to help others decide whether or not this is a good purchase. With 496 hours (6/19/21), I've had many experiences with this game, both good and bad. Not every game is perfect, and not every game will be of everyone's liking. I hope this review helps identify the aspects of this game well to help you with your purchase! :)

[u] General [/u]
In my personal opinion, I would rate this game a 7/10, but of course, this is heavily subject to change. Am I saying this is a bad game? No, in fact, this is probably my favorite game, despite the cons that are followed. If you aren't clearly aware of what this game is, it's a 4v1 multiplayer game, where there are four survivors and one killer. The survivors' objective is to repair five out of eight generators and escape before being sacrificed to the entity by the killer. The killer's job, surprise surprise, is to kill all four survivors and not let any of them escape. More specifically, you must hook each survivor three times to sacrifice them to the entity, which renders them dead. 

One of the things I like most about this game is the amount of collaborations with licensed characters the devs added, such as Freddy Krueger, Michael Myers, Nemesis, and my favorite, the Demogorgon. This game itself has brought me into watching the horror movies these characters came from, which is now my favorite genre. Overall, this game has shaped my likings, with being my favorite game as well as welcoming me to new experiences in every day life.

[u] Pros and Cons of DBD [/u]
Here I will list the pros and cons of Dead by Daylight.

PROS:
- Straight forward game, not very difficult to get the hang of.
- Use of teamwork and team bonding.
- Very efficient game to play with friends on.
- Make new friends and enter a new community.
- Easy to make videos with, stream, clip, etc.
- Playable killers and survivors from familiar movies / shows.
- Consistent major updates (every 3 months) with new killers and survivors.
- Devs host meaningful and fun events, such as the LGBTQ live streams, holiday events, anniversary events, etc.
- Though sometimes toxic, a great community to share likings with others.
- Devs constantly striving to make the game look better/feel better. (New animations, new UI, remodeled meshes, reworked maps, etc.)

CONS:
- Occasional bugs/glitches/crashes, especially after a major update before bug fixes.
- Maps rarely disabled due to issues.
- Common boring matches, where killers decide to either tunnel, camp, slug, etc.
- Match making screws up often. Lots of reports for players who go against much higher or much lower ranks than their own.
- Finding a match can take quite a bit of time, especially at night.
- Updating the game seems fairly quickly, but unpacking can take about 20 minutes.
- **Hitboxes** (for example, a killer can hit you from their screen when you're far away from them on yours).
- VPNing/lag switching/bad ping/bad internet can lead to a very laggy game.

[u] Conclusion [/u]
I hope this review slightly helps! Overall, this game is my favorite game of all, even though there are slight cons to this game. This kind of game is one of those love/hate games, where you either love it or hate it, depending on the match you have. Hope this helped, and I hope you have a great day/night! :)

-KimShaY / Maddie
